Description: Mould-made head of African man, possibly from a pottery vessel, broken away from any body. Wholly black. From a two-piece mould; very fine red-brown fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar black glazed African head and foot found at Naukratis from a later development from Sotadean rhyta, produced in Southern Italy or Athens in the late 4th century BC. These two pieces from Naukratis come from the same mould, but do not join (Ashmolean AN1896-1908-E.4656; British Museum GR1886,0401.1432). Unprovenanced complete parallel from same mould in Bonn (Schmidt 1997, 113-4, no. 158, pl.51). Schmidt, S. 1997. Katalog der Ptolemäischen und Kaiserzeitlichen objekte aus Ägypten im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn, Munich.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.406) (Phase 3)
